post_text:
The textbook and supply pick up event has been changed to Wed. from 5-7:00 pm. Elementary students pick up supplies at oak campus and middle and high school students will pick up at Armour. Those supplies are different from the Yubbler supply list and include teacher-created kits that students will use while in online class. Wednesday is also student success night at Armour. However, it will be done in the form of a video that you can watch at your convenience. The video will be emailed out on Wednesday evening.

Oak's student success night will be a live virtual meeting on Tuesday and 6:00 and Cherry's will also be live on Thursday at 6:00. Be on the lookout for an email from your child's teacher with the links.
text:

post_text: Welcome the inaugural class of Acad√©mie Lafayette International High School to their first day of Freshman year! It has been a long journey to reach the goal of AL providing another opportunity of free, high quality education to the students of Kansas City. A big thank you to the high school committee and all those who contributed to make this bold vision a reality.
text: Welcome the inaugural class of Acad√©mie Lafayette International High School to their first day of Freshman year! It has been a long journey to reach the goal of AL providing another opportunity of free, high quality education to the students of Kansas City. A big thank you to the high school committee and all those who contributed to make this bold vision a reality.

AL's first 9th-grade class created and staged a play during summer school without ever being together in the same room. Don't miss it!
You are cordially invited to the world premiere of:

The Curse of the Maskless Karen
Friday, July 24, 2020
6:00 PM Central Time

Follow this link and click "Set Reminder" to get a notification before the premiere.
If you miss the premiere, you can use the same link to watch it any time after.

post_text: The third floor of Armour is undergoing renovations in preparation for the opening of Acad√©mie Lafayette International High School in August. Take a look at some photos of our English and math classrooms! They have been updated with new flexible classroom furniture and beautiful cabinetry. We will share photos of our new multimedia journalism room and maker space later this summer. We can't wait to get our first freshman class into these spaces!
text: The third floor of Armour is undergoing renovations in preparation for the opening of Acad√©mie Lafayette International High School in August. Take a look at some photos of our English and math classrooms! They have been updated with new flexible classroom furniture and beautiful cabinetry. We will share photos of our new multimedia journalism room and maker space later this summer. We can't wait to get our first freshman class into these spaces!

post_text:
Tomorrow from 10-12:00, free sack lunches and breakfasts will be available for pick up at the east door of the Armour campus. This service will be available to all AL students from all three campuses on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. Please fill out the survey below to give us an idea of how many lunches and breakfast sacks to order.

Please direct questions about this service and other needs your family may have to your school counselor or social worker. They are ready and willing to help during this difficult time.

- Armour campus - Liz Seely - lseely@academielafayette.org
- Oak campus- Adam Nachum - anachum@academielafayette.org
- Cherry campus- Sheila Baskin - sbaskin@academielafayette.org

post_text: Remember that tomorrow is our Go Blue Day! AL will be "going blue" to show our support for our students and families living with type 1 diabetes. Students and staff can pay $1 to wear a casual blue clothing item. Blue jeans? Yep! Blue track pants? Sure thing. Your favorite teal hoodie? Absolutely. All funds raised will benefit JDRF to support finding a cure for T1D. We can't wait to see you go blue!

post_text:
Would your family consider hosting an intern during the second semester this school year? Interns are university students from French-speaking countries who spend a year working in the classrooms of our youngest students. One of our families signed up to host for just one semester, and so we have an intern in need of a second-semester family.

Host families welcome the intern into their home and provide a private bedroom and meals when you are together as a family. The school provides a generous monthly stipend to the intern and a monthly city bus pass. Hosting an intern is a great way for your children to speak French at home, to discover more about francophone culture, and to have someone to visit when your family goes to France in the future!

If you would like more information about hosting, please contact Diane Balagna, 816-888-7400 or dbalagna@academielafayette.org.
shared_text:
Acad√©mie Lafayette added 11 new photos to the album: Interns and Host Families ‚Äî with Rich Lees.
April 12, 2019 at 9:03 PM ¬∑

Interns are university students from France who work in classrooms at our school. They are eager to improve their English and discover American culture by living with a host family. Many interns and host families keep in touch and visit one another on vacations. If you‚Äôve always wanted ‚Äúa family member‚Äù in France, to learn more about the French language and culture, or brush up on French you might have forgotten, this is a great way to do it!

Please contact Diane Balagna at 816-888-7461 or email dbalagna@academielafayette.org for more information about becoming a host family!

post_text:
Voting for #50KGIVEAWAY has officially begun! Acad√©mie Lafayette family we need your help! Share, like and love the post below! Here are the rules from Lillian James Creative:

1. Our team will choose two winners. You pick the other three!

2. Simply like or love the organizations you want to win ‚Äî and don't forget to share the post so other people can vote for them, too.

3. Vote for as many organizations as you want (or not).

4. The last day to vote is December 30 and the winners will be announced on New Year's Eve.

5. Services will be rewarded in 2020.
shared_text:
Lillian James Creative
November 1, 2019 at 4:53 PM ¬∑

Acad√©mie Lafayette's vision is where Kansas City children grow up to be academically excellent, globally responsible and active participants in the world community. Our mission is to educate the children of Kansas City to become globally-minded, locally active, critical thinkers through immersion in world languages and cultures.

Like or love this post to vote for Academie Lafayette!

Do you love to read? The Title I team is looking for parent volunteers to help mentor student participants and their families at the Open Books workshop. Commit to being a literacy mentor just one Tuesday evening a month October through March, and make a BIG difference in our AL community!

Sessions are in the Armour Campus Cafeteria from 5:45 p.m. to 7:00 p.m.
- Tuesday, October 15, 2019
- Tuesday, November 12, 2019
- Tuesday, December 10, 2019
- Tuesday, January 14, 2020
- Tuesday, February 11, 2020
- Tuesday, March 10, 2020

If you are interested in being a literacy mentor, please contact Keith Christensen for more information at kchristensen@academielafayette.org.

post_text:
Some of our students are already turning in raffle ticket proceeds and that's incredible! To give everyone an opportunity to be a part of the raffle, below is a link to a sign-up sheet with locations where kids can sell tickets. Please remember that this is open to everyone, so please do not sign up for more than five shifts.

Tickets will not be available over the weekends. If you have signed up for a location, please see the front desk at each campus for additional tickets in advance. Please return any tickets that you do not believe will be sold to the school as soon as possible so that we may give them to someone else.

Good luck!
Chris Neher, cneher@academielafayette.org

post_text:
Attention everyone!
- We have been notified that some of our email communications are now going to the spam and junk folders. We have not changed anything, so you might need to check those folders and flag them as "not spam" in order for them to go to your inbox again.
- We clear our contact lists every year and do a clean upload based on our updated student information. This means that if you only listed yourself as guardian 1 and guardian 2 on your child's enrollment paperwork, your spouse/significant other WILL NOT be getting emails or phone calls or even be contacted in case of emergency as we will not have that information available. You can go to your child's application in SchoolMint to double-check the information you gave the school. If you need to update something, please contact Peggy Arians, parians@academielafayette.org and Edem Addoh, eaddoh@academielafayette.org.
- If you did not get a newsletter this Friday, please email communication@academielafayette.org to get on the list.

shared_text:
United Inner City Services - UICS is with Brooke Chonko.
July 25, 2019 at 11:32 PM ¬∑

On Saturday, we hosted two phenomenal volunteer groups for service projects! Parishioners of Resurrection Downtown worked to organize our diaper distribution center, along with projects in our Art Studio.

Academie Lafayette provided volunteers to help with sensory items for the upcoming school year, including dying 50 pounds of rice and assembling pinwheels!

Both groups consisted of volunteers of all ages, where families wanted to show a younger generation the value of service.

We are so happy with the work that was done, and appreciate the time, effort, and resources!
text:
https://www.facebook.com/154497771288932/posts/2897003020371713/

Academie Lafayette provided volunteers to help with sensory items for the upcoming school year, including dying 50 pounds of rice and assembling pinwheels!

Both groups consisted of volunteers of all ages, where families wanted to show a younger generation the value of service.

We are so happy with the work that was done, and appreciate the time, effort, and resources!

post_text: Can You Host a New AL Teacher? New Acad√©mie Lafayette teachers are arriving as early as next week and we are urgently looking for host families for them. Host families provide a private bedroom and meals for 30 days after the teacher's arrival. Most teachers are single and coming alone, but a few have a partner or child coming with them. If you are interested in opening your home to a new Acad√©mie Lafayette teacher, please contact Diane Balagna at dbalagna@academielafayette.org or call 816-888-7400.

For info contact Robyn King at rking@academielafayette.org

post_text: Acad√©mie Lafayette is excited to join the Diverse Charter Schools Coalition as its newest member school. We are proud to join a network of 57 members dedicated to creating excellent, inclusive, and equitable schools for all children. Check out more about the Coalition at www.diversecharters.org!
